column4: QUESTION: How does one get Radio Stations into the Music Player?? (I can't find where I get a list of stations)
How can I tar -xvf xxxx.tar so that the files are placed into root and NOT the relative to the directory in which I am executing the tar???
Thanks... I was going blind looking for that option :)
reading back, avu had a simpler method; I use that one because I usually needed to get into root after the untar
your very first destructive testing, I take it

hahahaha   yes .... very!!!!   better than one of the operators at Control Data who had a head crash on a removable disk pack, removed the pack, and tried it on 8 other disk units.... transferring metal oxide bits to every obne of the drives (thus, ruining them)
This is pretty kewl.... My user id looked quite broken... I logged of to get ready for the Rescue boot, but tried to log back in again... linux repaired itself... happy camper time :)
something was out of sync, it seems. Perseverance Provides ;)
you ever use the shotgun approach to troubleshooting (hm, I think we're getting off topic here, too badk)
Guess what??? My regular user ... now has root privileges!!!!  Have I discoevered a HOLE in ubuntu security?
you shouldn't, you may have some oddities though. what's your user number?
bummer. First one out. What groups do you belong to?
It was something residual --- a reboot fixed it ---- weird
